diagnosis.text: Mild traumatic brain injury (concussion) after a bicycle accident

medications: - Ibuprofen 400mg, 1 tablet every 6-8 hours as needed - Ondansetron 4mg, 1 tablet as needed for nausea
follow_up: - Avoid screen time and strenuous activity for 72 hours - Do not drive or operate machinery for 5 days - Monitor for symptoms such as vomiting, confusion, or worsening headache - Follow-up with family doctor in 3 days Patient Discharge Summary Physician: Dr. Markus Neumann
raw_text: Patient Discharge Summary Name: Michael Bauer DOB: 09/03/1984 Date of Visit: 28/06/2025 Diagnosis: Mild traumatic brain injury (concussion) after a bicycle accident Treatment Given: - Neurological observation for 24 hours - CT scan of the head (no acute findings) - Pain management with Ibuprofen - Brief physical therapy consultation Medications on Discharge: - Ibuprofen 400mg, 1 tablet every 6-8 hours as needed - Ondansetron 4mg, 1 tablet as needed for nausea Discharge Instructions: - Avoid screen time and strenuous activity for 72 hours - Do not drive or operate machinery for 5 days - Monitor for symptoms such as vomiting, confusion, or worsening headache - Follow-up with family doctor in 3 days Patient Discharge Summary Physician: Dr. Markus Neumann
